intro: Aquilegia bertolonii, commonly known as the Bertoloni's columbine, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Europe. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its striking, spurred flowers that come in shades of red, purple, and blue. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with basal leaves divided into lobes and upper leaves that are more elongated. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Aquilegia bertolonii prefers well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade, making it a suitable addition to rock gardens and alpine gardens.
